Going into the holiday weekend we know families will be excited to have friends and family over. However, Goshen Community Schools is asking that you think twice before you attend these gatherings. As evidenced by the entire JV and Varsity football team, one single case of COVID-19 can put an entire team and season in jeopardy. Getting a negative COVID test does not bring these players out of quarantine because the virus can show up as late as 14 days from initial contact. Coaches and student-athletes have been working way too hard to see their season interrupted so abruptly.

We need all students to remain vigilant about physical distancing, wearing masks and washing hands when outside of school. Parents we need you to work with us in continuing these practices at home and out in public. Working as a team, we can ensure that the remainder of the Fall Sports season goes smoothly. Remember, there is no "I" in TEAM. Wash your wings and cover your beak!

#MaskUpGoshen

The Elkhart County Health Department strongly recommends that every individual living in, working in, or otherwise entering Elkhart County follow this Guidance on Wearing Face Coverings
Every individual should properly wear a face covering over their nose and mouth when they are at:
1. an indoor area open to the public, including public transportation;
2. an outdoor public area where a distance of 6 feet from individuals outside of their household cannot be maintained; or
3. a private indoor or outdoor area where a distance of 6 feet from individuals outside of their household cannot be maintained.
The intent of this Guidance is to ensure that all people in Elkhart County, whether
engaged in work activities, social activities, or everyday activities, recognize the important role a face covering can have in preventing the spread of COVID-19.
